qas.question: How many standard variants of the Serbo-Croatian are spoken?
In which areas are the four standard Serbo-Croatian variants spoken?

answers.text: Serbia, Croatia, Montenegro and Bosnia and Herzegovina.

qas.question: Who concluded that Serbo-Croatian is a pluricentric language?
Who believes Serbo-Croatian is one language with multiple variants?

plausible_answers.text: there is only one Serbo-Croatian language with several varieties

qas.question: What do the Dutch argue about language?

plausible_answers.text: it is a pluricentric language, with four standard variants spoken in Serbia, Croatia, Montenegro and Bosnia and Herzegovina

qas.question: What is the conclustion by Hindi-Urdu about Serbo-Croation language?
How many varieties does Enisa Kafadar aruge there are in Hindi-Urdu?
What is incluced into a new pluricentric language?

plausible_answers.text: Serbia, Croatia, Montenegro and Bosnia and Herzegovina

qas.question: Where are four variants of English spoken?

context: <a3_0>Enisa Kafadar<a3_0/> argues that <b4_0>there is only one Serbo-Croatian language with <b6_0>several<b6_0/> varieties<b4_0/>. This has made possible to include <b7_0>all four varieties<b7_0/> into a new grammar book. <a2_0>Daniel Bunčić<a2_0/> concludes that <b5_0>it is a pluricentric language, with <a0_0>four<a0_0/> standard variants spoken in <a1_0><b8_0>Serbia, Croatia, Montenegro and Bosnia and Herzegovina<b8_0/><b5_0/>.<a1_0/> The mutual intelligibility between their speakers "exceeds that between the standard variants of English, French, German, or Spanish". Other linguists have argued that the differences between the variants of Serbo-Croatian are less significant than those between the variants of English, German,, Dutch, and Hindi-Urdu.
